Calculate summary statistics grouped by

Source: R/dby.R
dby.Rd

Calculate summary statistics grouped by variable

dby(
  data,
  INPUT,
  ...,
  ID = NULL,
  ORDER = NULL,
  SUBSET = NULL,
  SORT = 0,
  COMBINE = !REDUCE,
  NOCHECK = FALSE,
  ARGS = NULL,
  NAMES,
  COLUMN = FALSE,
  REDUCE = FALSE,
  REGEX = mets.options()$regex,
  ALL = TRUE
)

Arguments

data

Data.frame
INPUT

Input variables (character or formula)
...

functions
ID

id variable
ORDER

(optional) order variable
SUBSET

(optional) subset expression
SORT

sort order (id+order variable)
COMBINE

If TRUE result is appended to data
NOCHECK

No sorting or check for missing data
ARGS

Optional list of arguments to functions (...)
NAMES

Optional vector of column names
COLUMN

If TRUE do the calculations for each column
REDUCE

Reduce number of redundant rows
REGEX

Allow regular expressions
ALL

if FALSE only the subset will be returned

Details

Calculate summary statistics grouped by

dby2 for column-wise calculations

Examples

n <- 4
k <- c(3,rbinom(n-1,3,0.5)+1)
N <- sum(k)
d <- data.frame(y=rnorm(N),x=rnorm(N),id=rep(seq(n),k),num=unlist(sapply(k,seq)))
d2 <- d[sample(nrow(d)),]

dby(d2, y~id, mean)
#>              y           x id num        mean
#> 3  -1.55336807 -2.03545050  1   3 -1.06455561
#> 1  -1.79543538  0.55634005  1   1 -1.06455561
#> 2   0.15513661  0.03833857  1   2 -1.06455561
#> 4  -0.71603154 -0.06096876  2   1 -0.26978853
#> 5  -0.87809866  1.05140078  2   2 -0.26978853
#> 6   0.78476462 -0.11705507  2   3 -0.26978853
#> 10 -0.30420261  0.19521967  3   4 -0.03992063
#> 7   0.36620380 -1.21157397  3   1 -0.03992063
#> 8  -0.20842081  1.16618593  3   2 -0.03992063
#> 9  -0.01326291  0.46188895  3   3 -0.03992063
#> 11 -0.24722026 -0.18616474  4   1 -0.24722026
dby(d2, y~id + order(num), cumsum)
#>              y           x id num     cumsum
#> 1  -1.79543538  0.55634005  1   1 -1.7954354
#> 2   0.15513661  0.03833857  1   2 -1.6402988
#> 3  -1.55336807 -2.03545050  1   3 -3.1936668
#> 4  -0.71603154 -0.06096876  2   1 -0.7160315
#> 5  -0.87809866  1.05140078  2   2 -1.5941302
#> 6   0.78476462 -0.11705507  2   3 -0.8093656
#> 7   0.36620380 -1.21157397  3   1  0.3662038
#> 8  -0.20842081  1.16618593  3   2  0.1577830
#> 9  -0.01326291  0.46188895  3   3  0.1445201
#> 10 -0.30420261  0.19521967  3   4 -0.1596825
#> 11 -0.24722026 -0.18616474  4   1 -0.2472203

dby(d,y ~ id + order(num), dlag)
#>              y           x id num        dlag
#> 1  -1.79543538  0.55634005  1   1          NA
#> 2   0.15513661  0.03833857  1   2 -1.79543538
#> 3  -1.55336807 -2.03545050  1   3  0.15513661
#> 4  -0.71603154 -0.06096876  2   1          NA
#> 5  -0.87809866  1.05140078  2   2 -0.71603154
#> 6   0.78476462 -0.11705507  2   3 -0.87809866
#> 7   0.36620380 -1.21157397  3   1          NA
#> 8  -0.20842081  1.16618593  3   2  0.36620380
#> 9  -0.01326291  0.46188895  3   3 -0.20842081
#> 10 -0.30420261  0.19521967  3   4 -0.01326291
#> 11 -0.24722026 -0.18616474  4   1          NA
dby(d,y ~ id + order(num), dlag, ARGS=list(k=1:2))
#>              y           x id num       dlag1      dlag2
#> 1  -1.79543538  0.55634005  1   1          NA         NA
#> 2   0.15513661  0.03833857  1   2 -1.79543538         NA

#> 4  -0.71603154 -0.06096876  2   1          NA         NA

#> 7   0.36620380 -1.21157397  3   1          NA         NA

#> 9  -0.01326291  0.46188895  3   3 -0.20842081  0.3662038
#> 10 -0.30420261  0.19521967  3   4 -0.01326291 -0.2084208
#> 11 -0.24722026 -0.18616474  4   1          NA         NA
dby(d,y ~ id + order(num), dlag, ARGS=list(k=1:2), NAMES=c("l1","l2"))
#>              y           x id num          l1         l2
#> 1  -1.79543538  0.55634005  1   1          NA         NA
#> 2   0.15513661  0.03833857  1   2 -1.79543538         NA

#> 4  -0.71603154 -0.06096876  2   1          NA         NA

#> 7   0.36620380 -1.21157397  3   1          NA         NA

#> 9  -0.01326291  0.46188895  3   3 -0.20842081  0.3662038
#> 10 -0.30420261  0.19521967  3   4 -0.01326291 -0.2084208
#> 11 -0.24722026 -0.18616474  4   1          NA         NA

dby(d, y~id + order(num), mean=mean, csum=cumsum, n=length)
#>              y           x id num        mean       csum n
#> 1  -1.79543538  0.55634005  1   1 -1.06455561 -1.7954354 3
#> 2   0.15513661  0.03833857  1   2 -1.06455561 -1.6402988 3
#> 3  -1.55336807 -2.03545050  1   3 -1.06455561 -3.1936668 3
#> 4  -0.71603154 -0.06096876  2   1 -0.26978853 -0.7160315 3
#> 5  -0.87809866  1.05140078  2   2 -0.26978853 -1.5941302 3
#> 6   0.78476462 -0.11705507  2   3 -0.26978853 -0.8093656 3
#> 7   0.36620380 -1.21157397  3   1 -0.03992063  0.3662038 4
#> 8  -0.20842081  1.16618593  3   2 -0.03992063  0.1577830 4
#> 9  -0.01326291  0.46188895  3   3 -0.03992063  0.1445201 4
#> 10 -0.30420261  0.19521967  3   4 -0.03992063 -0.1596825 4
#> 11 -0.24722026 -0.18616474  4   1 -0.24722026 -0.2472203 1
dby(d2, y~id + order(num), a=cumsum, b=mean, N=length, l1=function(x) c(NA,x)[-length(x)])
#>              y           x id num          a           b N         l1

dby(d, y~id + order(num), nn=seq_along, n=length)

#>              y           x id num nn n

d <- d[,1:4]
dby(d, x<0) <- list(z=mean)
#> Warning: Using formula(x) is deprecated when x is a character vector of length > 1.
#>   Consider formula(paste(x, collapse = " ")) instead.
d <- dby(d, is.na(z), z=1)
#> Warning: Using formula(x) is deprecated when x is a character vector of length > 1.
#>   Consider formula(paste(x, collapse = " ")) instead.

f <- function(x) apply(x,1,min)
dby(d, y+x~id, min=f)
#> Error in .ApplyBy2(INPUT, ID, F = expr, Env = env, Argument = "x", Columnwise = COLUMN): object 'f' not found

dby(d,y+x~id+order(num), function(x) x)
#>              y           x id num         z         _11         _12
#> 1  -1.79543538  0.55634005  1   1 1.0000000 -1.79543538  0.55634005
#> 2   0.15513661  0.03833857  1   2 1.0000000  0.15513661  0.03833857

f <- function(x) { cbind(cumsum(x[,1]),cumsum(x[,2]))/sum(x)}
dby(d, y+x~id, f)
#> Error in .ApplyBy2(INPUT, ID, F = expr, Env = env, Argument = "x", Columnwise = COLUMN): object 'f' not found

## column-wise
a <- d
dby2(a, mean, median, REGEX=TRUE) <- '^[y|x]'~id
a
#>              y           x id num         z      mean.y     mean.x   median.y
#> 1  -1.79543538  0.55634005  1   1 1.0000000 -1.06455561 -0.4802573 -1.5533681

a <- iris
a <- dby(a,y=1)
dby(a,Species=="versicolor") <- list(y=2)
